I WANT YOU TO MAKE SURE EVERYONE COMES AND READS THIS......IF NOT, COPY AND PASTE IN YOUR OWN JOURNAL.

It's a new phenomenon: online journals, or blogging. It's a way for you to get stuff off your chest and put it out into the open. The problem is, your friends, foes, and family can get their hands on this. Unless you are very vague in your journals, it will come back to get you, and you will get several nasty replies, in both the journal itself and in real life. Here are some things that could go wrong......

FRIENDS: A friend could make you mad or you suddenly get pissed at them~~>and vent in your journal. Problem with this is that your friend will read it or someone who is friends with them will read it and you'll have a blog war going on.....that will translate into real life. Not fun. So be choosy about what goes in, or make those offensive entries private. And if you don't care if others read it, then prepare yourself for the battle you'll receive.

FOES: Let's say you're harboring a secret and all your friends know about your journal and read it more than the daily paper. Well, if your friends and strangers have access to it, doesn't your enemy. Like, if you just had sex, or you're pregnant, or you're gay, or your parents are getting divorced, whatever...something personal, your enemy finds it, prints it out, and hangs it all over school, reads it over the intercom, etc....that's why you should be choosy about what goes in your online journal.

And finally.....FAMILY: This is probably the least harmful to some. They can take it if their parents get mad at them for really going to get their eyebrow pierced instead of working, but they cannot handle it when their friends and classmates turn their backs on them for being gay. But, mind you, you can still get in trouble and grounded. And the ex post facto laws do not apply to parenting, they should, but they do not.

Blogs break up friendships, or at least put a lot of strain in them. So please be critical when writing your journal.

Peace and hair grease, paste this in your blog.

~Jen
